name: Counting
description: Learning to count music, and finding the rhythm helps you to recognize patterns so that you can predict what sounds are coming up in the song.
content: Let’s start simple. Pick a small arm motion, or keep it simple with a head nod that you will do to find the beat of the song.

name: Accents
description: Songs don’t usually keep the same steady beat throughout, especially the ones that make us want to get up and dance.
content: We will do the same motions we did in the first step, and in tune with the accents in the music, we will replace the numbers with the sound ‘Ka’.

name: Tempo
description: Tempo refers to the speed at which you count. You can count in half time, or twice as fast.
content: First, try counting this song at a basic tempo, using the whoa to accent the bass on counts 1 and 5

name: The Pouncing Cat
description: The Pouncing Cat is a step originating from South African Amapiano style
content: In this bended knee position, start with your right foot and stand on your heel. Then do the same on your left.
